  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(int size, Player[] players)
      Constructs a GameBoard with the specified size and players. Initializes the grid and populates it with tiles.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the board (number of rows and columns)
      players - an array of Player objects participating in the game

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(Tile[][] tiles, Player[] players)
      Constructs a GameBoard with the specified tile layout and players. Used when synchronizing the game state between host and client.
      Parameters:
      tiles - a 2D array of Tile objects representing the board layout
      players - an array of Player objects participating in the game

  • Method Details

    • getTokenMap

      public Map<Point,JLabel> getTokenMap()
      Retrieves the map of tokens currently on the game board.
      Returns:
      a Map where the keys are the positions (Point) of the tokens and the values are the corresponding JLabel objects representing the tokens.

    • addToken

      public void addToken(Point position, JLabel tokenLabel)
      Adds a token to the game board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      position - the position (Point) where the token will be added
      tokenLabel - the JLabel representing the token to be added

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int row, int col)
      Retrieves the tile located at the specified row and column on the game board. This method checks if the requested position is within bounds and returns the corresponding tile if available. If the position is out of bounds, it logs an error and returns null.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the requested tile (0-based)
      col - the column index of the requested tile (0-based)
      Returns:
      the Tile object at the specified position, or null if the position is out of bounds or the tile does not exist

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the size of the game board (number of rows or columns).
      Returns:
      the size of the game board

    • getTileAt

      public Tile getTileAt(Point position)
      Retrieves the tile at the specified position on the game board.
      Parameters:
      position - a Point object representing the row and column of the tile
      Returns:
      the Tile at the specified position

    • getTiles

      public Tile[][] getTiles()
      Returns the two-dimensional array of tiles representing the game board. This method is used for serialization or synchronization of the game state.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of Tile objects

    • setTiles

      public void setTiles(Tile[][] tiles)
      Sets the two-dimensional array of tiles for the game board. This method is used for deserialization or synchronization of the game state.
      Parameters:
      tiles - a 2D array of Tile objects to set as the game board

    • getPlayers

      public Player[] getPlayers()
      Returns the array of players currently in the game.
      Returns:
      an array of Player objects

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(Player[] players)
      Sets the array of players for the game. This method is used for updating or synchronizing the player data.
      Parameters:
      players - an array of Player objects to set

    • movePlayer

      public boolean movePlayer(Player player, String direction)
      Moves the specified player in the given direction if the move is valid. This method checks if the target position is within bounds, not blocked, and accessible based on the current and target tile connections. If the move is valid, it updates the player's position.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to move
      direction - the direction to move ("up", "down", "left", or "right")
      Returns:
      true if the player successfully moves, false otherwise

    • isValidPosition

      public boolean isValidPosition(Point position)
      Checks if the specified position is within the playable grid and not out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      position - a Point object representing the target position
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, false otherwise

    • isTileOccupied

      public boolean isTileOccupied(Point position)
      Checks if the specified tile is occupied by any player.
      Parameters:
      position - a Point object representing the target position
      Returns:
      true if the tile is occupied by a player, false otherwise

    • shiftColumnDown

      public void shiftColumnDown(int col, JPanel gridPanel, JPanel insertPanel)
      Shifts a column of tiles downwards in the grid. This method moves the tiles in the specified column down by one position, taking the bottommost tile and placing it in the insert panel. The new tile from the insert panel is placed at the top of the column.
      Parameters:
      col - the column index to be shifted
      gridPanel - the JPanel representing the game grid
      insertPanel - the JPanel representing the insert panel

    • shiftColumnUp

      public void shiftColumnUp(int col, JPanel gridPanel, JPanel insertPanel)
      Shifts a column of tiles upwards in the grid. This method moves the tiles in the specified column up by one position, taking the topmost tile and placing it in the insert panel. The new tile from the insert panel is placed at the bottom of the column.
      Parameters:
      col - the column index to be shifted
      gridPanel - the JPanel representing the game grid
      insertPanel - the JPanel representing the insert panel

    • shiftRowRight

      public void shiftRowRight(int row, JPanel gridPanel, JPanel insertPanel)
      Shifts a row of tiles to the right in the grid. This method moves the tiles in the specified row to the right by one position, taking the rightmost tile and placing it in the insert panel. The new tile from the insert panel is placed at the leftmost position of the row.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index to be shifted
      gridPanel - the JPanel representing the game grid
      insertPanel - the JPanel representing the insert panel

    • shiftRowLeft

      public void shiftRowLeft(int row, JPanel gridPanel, JPanel insertPanel)
      Shifts a row of tiles to the left in the grid. This method moves the tiles in the specified row to the left by one position, taking the leftmost tile and placing it in the insert panel. The new tile from the insert panel is placed at the rightmost position of the row.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index to be shifted
      gridPanel - the JPanel representing the game grid
      insertPanel - the JPanel representing the insert panel

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove(Player player, String direction)
      Determines if a player can move in the specified direction. This method evaluates whether the movement from the player's current position to the target position is valid based on the tile connections, grid boundaries, and the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player attempting the move
      direction - the direction of movement ("up", "down", "left", "right")
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid and allowed; false otherwise

    • handleTileInsert

      public void handleTileInsert(int row, int col, String direction, JPanel gridPanel, JPanel insertPanel)
      Handles the insertion of a tile at the specified position and direction for networking This method manages tile insertion logic for networking scenarios by updating the game grid and UI based on the provided row, column, and direction of the insertion.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index where the tile is inserted
      col - the column index where the tile is inserted
      direction - the direction of the insertion ("down", "up", "right", "left")
      gridPanel - the JPanel representing the game grid
      insertPanel - the JPanel representing the insert tile panel
